section.section:
The application fee:
for a contractor license is $250 for each place of business of the contractor;
for a subcontractor license is $150; or
for a salesperson license is $100.
The fee for processing an application is $20.

text.section:
To evaluate the qualifications of an applicant for a license, the Commission may ask the applicant for:
information about the applicant's character, experience, and financial stability; and
any other information that the Commission needs.

If the applicant is applying for a contractor license, the applicant shall:
have submitted to the Commission, by a credit reporting agency approved by the Commission, a credit report that contains the information required by the Commission; or
have paid to the Commission or the Commission's designee a credit report fee in an amount not to exceed the cost charged by a credit reporting agency approved by the Commission to obtain a credit report that contains the information required by the Commission.

Financial information that an applicant submits to the Commission:
is confidential and is not a public record; but
if relevant, is admissible as evidence in an administrative or judicial proceeding.

Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, an applicant that is incorporated or has its principal office in another state shall pay to the Commission the fee imposed in that state on a similar nonresident business if that fee is higher than the application fee under subsection (a) of this section.
